summary: This document is an email chain regarding a draft letter to a judge (MN) concerning the admissibility of co-conspirator statements in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The correspondence involves attorneys preparing the submission, which is due that same night.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the legal correspondence; the letter being drafted concerns co-conspirator statements in her case.

events.title: Deadline for Co-Conspirator Statement Letter
events.description: Prosecutors have a deadline to submit a letter to the judge (MN) seeking to admit certain co-conspirator statements in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

keyFacts: Prosecutors were preparing a legal letter regarding the admissibility of co-conspirator statements in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The correspondence indicates an imminent legal filing deadline, set for midnight on November 12, 2021.
The document references prior exchanged letters with the defense on the same topic, showing ongoing legal negotiations.
The recipient of the letter is identified only by the initials 'MN', likely referring to the presiding judge.
